Spokane.Hillyard, Spokane:
Hillyard, Washington is a neighborhood in Spokane, Washington which existed as a separate town between 1892 and 1924.
The town came about due to the Great Northern Railway and was named for James J. Hill, then-head of the railroad. Between 1904 and 1912, many of the town's houses were built, to house railroad workers working in the local yard.
